channel.title: Hubble News
channel.description: The latest news about astronomy and the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope

item.title: Photo Release: Hubble snaps heavyweight of the Leo Triplet
item.description: Hubble has snapped a spectacular view of the largest "player" in the Leo Triplet, a galaxy with an unusual anatomy: it displays asymmetric spiral arms and an apparently displaced core. The peculiar an...

item.title: News Release: Hubble confirms cosmic acceleration with weak lensing
item.description: A new study led by European scientists presents the most comprehensive analysis of data from the most ambitious survey ever undertaken by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. These researchers have, f...

item.title: Photo Release: Bully galaxy rules the neighbourhood
item.description: In general, galaxies can be thought of as "social" - hanging out in groups and frequently interacting. However, this recent NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image highlights how some galaxies appear to...

item.title: Photo Release: Saturn's aurorae offer stunning double show
item.description: Researchers using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope recently took advantage of a rare opportunity to record Saturn when its rings are edge-on, resulting in a unique movie featuring both of the giant...

item.title: News Release: Forming the present-day spiral galaxies
item.description: Using data from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have, for the first time, created a demographic census of galaxy types and shapes from a time before the Earth and the Sun existed, to ...

item.title: News Release: Hubble finds most distant primeval galaxies
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has broken the distance limit for galaxies and uncovered a primordial population of compact and ultra-blue galaxies that have never been seen before. The data from ...

item.title: News Release: Vampires and collisions rejuvenate stars
item.description: Using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have uncovered two distinct kinds of "rejuvenated" stars in the globular cluster Messier 30. A new study shows that both stellar collisions and a...

item.title: Photo Release: Born in beauty: proplyds in the Orion Nebula
item.description: A collection of 30 never-before-released images of embryonic planetary systems in the Orion Nebula are the highlight of the longest single Hubble Space Telescope project ever dedicated to the topic of...

item.title: Photo Release: Hubble's deepest view of Universe unveils never-before-seen galaxies
item.description: The new Wide Field Camera 3 aboard the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has taken the deepest image yet of the Universe in near-infrared light. The faintest and reddest objects in the image are likely ...

item.title: Photo Release: Blushing dusty nebula
item.description: A recent NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image of part of NGC 7023, or the Iris Nebula, highlights a perfect dust laboratory in the sky.

item.title: Photo Release: Baffling boxy bulge
item.description: Just as many people are surprised to find themselves packing on unexplained weight around the middle, astronomers find the evolution of bulges in the centres of spiral galaxies puzzling. A recent NASA...

item.title: Photo Release: Opening up a colourful cosmic Jewel Box
item.description: The combination of images taken by three exceptional telescopes: the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, the ESO Very Large Telescope on Cerro Paranal, the MPG/ESO 2.2-metre telescope at ESO’s La Silla o...

item.title: Photo Release: Sky merger yields sparkling dividends
item.description: A recent NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image captures what appears to be one very bright and bizarre galaxy, but is actually the result of a pair of spiral galaxies that resemble our own Milky Way s...

item.title: Photo Release: Stripped down: Hubble highlights two galaxies that are losing it
item.description: A newly released set of images, taken by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope before the recent Servicing Mission, highlight the ongoing drama in two galaxies in the Virgo Cluster affected by a process...

item.title: News Release: Rebirth of an icon: Hubble's first images since Servicing Mission 4
item.description: Astronomers today declared the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope a fully rejuvenated observatory ready for a new decade of exploration, with the release of observations from four of its six operating sc...

item.title: News Release: Hubble captures rare Jupiter collision
item.description: The checkout and calibration of the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has been interrupted to aim the recently refurbished observatory at a new expanding spot on the giant planet Jupiter. The spot, caus...

item.title: News Release: Historic Hubble Servicing Mission 4 ends with successful landing
item.description: The historic and successful Hubble Servicing Mission 4 concluded with a trouble-free Space Shuttle landing on Sunday. During a series of unprecedented spacewalks, astronauts replaced and repaired a to...

item.title: News Release: Servicing Mission 4 - the fifth and final visit to Hubble
item.description: On 11 May 2009 the Space Shuttle Atlantis will launch with a crew of seven to visit the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope and carry out the fifth and final servicing mission. The replacement and repair ...

item.title: Photo Release: Hubble celebrates 19th anniversary with fountain of youth
item.description: To commemorate the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope's 19 years of success, the orbiting telescope has photographed a peculiar system of galaxies known as Arp 194. This interacting group contains severa...

item.title: Photo Release: Dramatically backlit dust in giant galaxy
item.description: A new Hubble image highlights striking swirling dust lanes and glittering globular clusters in oddball galaxy NGC 7049.

item.title: Photo Release: Four of Saturn's moons parade by their parent
item.description: A new Hubble image shows four of Saturn's moons circling the ringed planet

item.title: News Release: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope provides new evidence for dark matter around small galaxies
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has uncovered a strong new line of evidence that galaxies are embedded in halos of dark matter.

item.title: Photo Release: Stars forced to relocate near the Southern Fish
item.description: A new Hubble image shows three galaxies locked in a gravitational tug-of-war that may result in the eventual demise of one of them.

item.title: Photo Release: Exceptionally deep view of strange galaxy
item.description: A spectacular new image of an unusual spiral galaxy in the Coma Galaxy Cluster has been created from data taken by the Advanced Camera for Surveys on the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. It reveals fi...

item.title: News Release: Hubble finds carbon dioxide on an extrasolar planet
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has discovered carbon dioxide in the atmosphere of a planet orbiting another star. This is an important step along the trail of finding the chemical biotracers of e...
